localised_text.tooltip_text: Autoresolve||Automatically resolve the battle if you have a clear advantage over the enemy. However, you will have a better chance of victory should you fight the battle manually.
Continue Siege||Continue the siege in order to construct further siege equipment, or attempt to wait out the enemy rather than assaulting.
Scout terrain||Display a preview of the battle map.

Retreat||Retreat from the battle. After reviewing the enemy details you may decide that the battle will not end in your favour. Should you be attacked again following the retreat, you will not be able to retreat a second time.
Break Siege||Lift the siege and retreat. After reviewing the enemy details you may decide that the siege will not end in your favour.
Encircle||Surround the settlement and wait out the enemy rather than attacking head-on.

dy_attrition.componentleveltooltip: Turns remaining until supplies run out and garrison starts suffering [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition

dy_description.componentleveltooltip: Your force's predicted strength||Your generals and admirals always try to predict the outcome of the battle as best as they can, but if they lack experience, the displayed values might be inaccurate. The accuracy of the prediction is based on your leader's experience level compared to the opposing leader's one.||The white box indicates the margin of error of your general's prediction.

component_text.text: Your forces attack an army of France

dy_turns.componentleveltooltip: Turns remaining until garrison is wiped out from [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition

default.name: default
default.tooltip: The settlement's gates will be open during the battle.

newstate.name: NewState
newstate.tooltip: You cannot starve out a port settlement through siege alone - it must also be blockaded by a fleet.

newstate.name: NewState
newstate.tooltip: You cannot starve out a port settlement through siege alone it must also be blockaded by a fleet.

callback_with_context.context_function_id: Format("%s: %d%%", Loc("wall_strength"), RoundFloat(WallsHealthPercent * 100)) + GetIfElse(NumWallBreaches > 0, Format(" %s: %d", Loc("num_breaches"), NumWallBreaches), "")

killometer.componentleveltooltip: Balance of Power||The greater the proportion of yellow on this bar, the greater the military superiority your army has over that of your opponent, and vice versa.

label_tx.componentleveltooltip: Initiate the battle with a lightning-strike manoeuvre.||Lightning strike battles will prevent reinforcements from arriving for both forces participating in the battle. However, your forces will begin the battle with reduced Vigour.
Controlling a large army allows you to take up to 40 units onto the battlefield at once, without waiting for reinforcements.

component_text.text: The battle will take place outside the settlement.
Siege vehicles are not available for this battle.
The battle will take place outside the settlement.
Siege equipment is unavailable to the Ogre Kingdoms.
